N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 622.3 - Daily commuting

State Regulations
(a) A
trainee, except as set forth under (b) below, who commutes daily to and from
the training facility, including a trainee who receives subsistence allowances
provided his choice for the location of his temporary residence is reasonable
in view of factors such as living cost and availability of accommodations, shall be reimbursed for the cost of travel: (1)
in amounts equal to the least expensive
means of public transportation by common carrier reasonably available to him, or
(2)
if there is no public
transportation that can reasonably meet his needs, in an amount calculated by
multiplying by five cents the mileage of the most direct route from his
residence, provided, however, that the cost so established may be reduced by 50
cents for each round-trip, with a maximum reduction by $2.50 per
week. (b) No
transportation allowances for daily commuting within a commuting area shall be
paid to a trainee engaged in on-the-job training for any week in which he has
been offered by the on-the-job employer compensated work for a full work week
customary in the industry for the occupation to which his training
relates. Notes
